body: @nov301996 Can you retry the build as the error message (`simple retry will get you on your way`) suggests?
@harupy , we tried a lot of times but still we are getting same error

I guess something is wrong with your network. Can you try the build with this dockerfile?

```
FROM condaforge/miniforge3

RUN conda install python=3.7
```

Still same error @harupy 

 mlflow % docker build . -t mlflow_orgin

@harupy  - I also tried with different python versions but still it failed with same error
@nov301996 What happens when you run conda on your host machine?

It is actually create a new conda env
I have no clue why it fails when building the image.
Can you try the docker build again?
@harupy  - sure, tried with and without VPN, both the time it is failing

> I have no clue why it fails when building the image.

It will be helpful if you can tag someone who knows/worked on this DockerFile
I think you can file an issue in https://github.com/conda/conda. I don't think MLflow is related.
